course_title: Special Topics: East Asian Studies: Soundscapes of China
class_notes:
(Same as CHN 375 2, MUS 370 4)
Class Description: From high-pitched voices in Peking opera to contemporary C-pop, from reverberations of the classical zither to echoes of the central drum tower in Beijing, from numerous dialects spoken (and sung) across various regions to online rap competitions, China is full of sounds with distinctive timbres. They have been experienced, imagined and theorized locally and in cross-cultural transmissions, sometimes in mediated forms such as literary and graphic descriptions. This course offers a comprehensive introduction to these sonic phenomena, using comparative and transmedia approaches to address their multicultural repercussions, while giving equal attention to their socio-historic contexts. You will gain an overview of the diverse, complex, and ever-evolving Chinese soundscape, aided by methods of sound studies and literary/cultural criticism.
course_description: Study of East Asian literature, history, society, thought, or culture, alone or in conjunction with other literary or cultural trends. Topics to be announced in advance.
